title: [K-12] Gamification and Adaptive Learning Design Workshop for Early Childhood Cognitive Development

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of cognitive development theory, experience in applying educational technology (EdTech), and understanding of project-based learning
context.additional_context: Participants are experts responsible for developing educational solutions in medical/legal/technical fields, interested in designing digital learning tools for young children. Through group collaboration, they develop prototypes applicable in real-world contexts

learning_goals: Learners design one gamified cognitive activity plan for young children using game elements (points, levels, rewards) and submit a final product meeting ≥4 of 5 peer-reviewed and instructor feedback criteria (e.g., creativity, applicability, educational effectiveness).
Learners solve ≥10 problems on a science quiz platform over 2 weeks, achieving ≥80% accuracy rate as the system dynamically adjusts difficulty levels (basic/intermediate/advanced) in real time.
Develop digital learning modules that can be proposed to actual early childhood education institutions through project-based assessment
Analyze interaction effects of prototypes running on tablet devices through quantitative and qualitative data
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
